intro: Staberoha stokoei, commonly known as the Stokoei mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and has a distinctive appearance with small, oval-shaped leaves and white or pale pink flowers. The plant lacks chlorophyll and relies on its host for water and nutrients, while it provides nectar to attract pollinators. Staberoha stokoei is often found in dense forests and plays a role in the ecological interactions of its habitat.
